CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

1. "photocurrent response of all of these polymers" - The phrase "these polymers" refers to specific polymers mentioned earlier in the text, so it's not a material name.
2. "external quantum efficiency (EQE)" - This is not a material name, it's a property or a measurement.
3. "the highest PCE of μmR - polymer" - "PCE" stands for power conversion efficiency, which is a property or a measurement. "μmR - polymer" is a type of polymer, but it's not a specific material name.
4. "poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine)" - This is a specific material name.
5. "photovoltaic μmR - polymers" - "μmR - polymers" is a type of polymer, but it's not a specific material name.
6. "3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP )" - This is a specific material name.
7. "PDTP - DTDPP" - This is a specific material name.
8. "alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP" - This is not a material name, it's a part of a material.
9. "PC 70 BM" - This is a specific material name.
10. "new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer" - This is not a specific material name, it's a type of polymer.
11. "PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)" - This is a specific material name.
12. "CHCl3, chlorobenzene, o-dichlorobenzene" - These are specific material names.
13. "number - average molecular weight ( Mn )" - This is not a material name, it's a property or a measurement.
14. "thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)" - "TGA" is a technique, not a material name.

So, the specific material names in this paragraph are "poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine)", "DTDPP", "PDTP - DTDPP", "PC 70 BM", and "PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) |
| DTDPP |
| PDTP - DTDPP |
| PC 70 BM |
| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) |

The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

1. Wavelength: 1 μm (micrometer) - mentioned in the first sentence as the wavelength up to which the photocurrent response of all the polymers extends.
2. External Quantum Efficiency (EQE): typically less than 10% in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm - mentioned in the first sentence as the EQE of the PSCs (polymer solar cells).
3. Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE): 1.1% - mentioned in the seventh sentence as the highest PCE of μmR-polymer based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine).
4. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energy level: not explicitly given, but it is mentioned that it should be high for effective photoinduced charge transfer.
5. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy level: not explicitly given, but it is mentioned that it should be low to keep the open circuit voltage (VOC) as high as possible.
6. Carrier mobility: not explicitly given, but it is mentioned that it should be high to ensure effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes and suppress photocurrent loss.
7. Absorption: broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm - mentioned in the second requirement for promising photovoltaic μmR-polymers.
8. Molecular weight: the number-average molecular weight (Mn) of the new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is 18.9 kg/mol with a polydispersity index (PDI) of 2.04 - mentioned in the last paragraph.
9. Thermal stability: not explicitly given, but a thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) plot of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1, indicating its thermal stability.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. 1 μm (micrometer) - wavelength
2. 10% - external quantum efficiency (EQE)
3. 1.1% - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
4. High - LUMO energy level
5. Low - HOMO energy level
6. High - carrier mobility
7. Broad absorption - extends to or surpasses 1 μm
8. 18.9 kg/mol - number-average molecular weight (Mn)
9. 2.04 - polydispersity index (PDI)
10. (TGA) - thermogravimetric analysis (indicates thermal stability)

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| typically less than 10% - external quantum efficiency (EQE) |
| 1.1% - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) |

| high - carrier mobility |
| broad absorption - extends to or surpasses 1 μm |

| thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) - indicates thermal stability |
